name: Premier Inn Birmingham Central (Hagley Road) hotel

reviews.text:
The toilet paper was empty upon arrival.
The room was clean and satisfactory.
There is no room service.
The TV had no casting capabilities, so it was either commercial television or nothing.
The internet was extremely poor. I'm assuming that's because they want you to pay for the upgrade. I didn't, so I can't comment on its capabilities.
All the staff were very friendly, pleasant, and helpful.
There was plenty of available parking, and it was easy to access.
It's a good place if you need a bed.

I have been living in hotels across BIRMINGHAM the past month for work and have stayed in several locations.

As they're currently undergoing renovations, the food was extremely limited however it was still enjoyable.

While this venue is a little dated, the service from Bradley in the evening was absolutely top notch and really made my trip enjoyable. He is an absolute credit to your team.

Easy to find, lots of parking. Rooms clean and tidy just what we needed. Morgan told us about the dinner deal which we was grateful for as saved us some money! We also had breakfast booked and all food was very nice.

We had a one night stay at this site. The room spotlessly clean and well presented, as was the ensuite, just dropped a star as the bathroom a little dated. The bath was fabulous and a good size.
We have always found the beds to be very comfortable and this was no exception.
We had the cooked breakfast option which includes continental and it was all enjoyable.
All staff here were very helpful and cheerful. Special shout out to Racheal (I think!) who served our breakfast with a joke and a smile - thank you!

The rooms are nice and tidy as most of there hotels.
However do NOT eat here.  No drafts on when I stayed as no gas only bottles.  Small tiny bottles aswell.  Coke was Tony and over priced for a bottle.
Menus is so limited a 5 year old could cook as many different dishes as what there is to select.
Chef late not here till after 1730.  Absolutely shocking has let the hotel down.
